perturbation.original_text: Racing shall obtain and maintain, at Racing's expense, comprehensive automobile liability insurance covering all owned, non-owned and hired vehicles used by Racing in the Business with limits of not less than $5,000,000 per occurrence combined single limit for personal injury and property damage, including all statutory coverage for all states of operation. Racing shall also provide comprehensive (fire and theft) and collision insurance on each vehicle used in the Business. Racing shall provide the Sponsor a certificate of insurance evidencing "Gainsco Inc. and all related entities" as additional insureds, stating that such insurance is primary in coverage to any other insurance which may be available the Sponsor, and providing at least thirty (30) days' prior written notice to the Sponsor of cancellation, modification or material change to the policy.
perturbation.changed_text: Racing shall obtain and maintain automobile liability insurance covering vehicles used by Racing in the Business. Racing shall provide the Sponsor a certificate of insurance evidencing "Gainsco Inc. and all related entities" as additional insureds.
perturbation.explanation: This change removes the specific coverage limits, the requirement for 'comprehensive' coverage, the inclusion of 'fire and theft' insurance, and the stipulation for 30 days' notice of policy changes. Texas law and standard business practices often require specific minimum liability coverage amounts for businesses operating vehicles. Omitting these details creates a legal risk for the Sponsor as it weakens their protection in case of an accident. It also omits that the insurance should be primary to other insurances that may be available to the sponsor, and does not specify how long the insurance coverage should last.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Texas Insurance Code, standard business practices for liability insurance

perturbation.original_text: (b) Racing shall obtain and maintain pursuant to the terms of this Agreement, at its sole expense, the following types of insurance coverage, with minimum limits as set forth below: (i) Commercial General Liability covering liability arising from premises, operations, independent contractors, personal and advertising injury and contractual liability—$5,000,000 each occurrence. 3 (ii) Racing Owners' Sponsors (Spectators) Legal Liability including Participant Legal Liability—$5,000,000 each occurrence. (iii) Business Automobile Liability covering all owned, hired and non-owned vehicles—$5,000,000 each occurrence, including statutory coverages for all states of operations. (iv) Workers Compensation—statutory limits for all states of operation. (v) Employers Liability—$5,000,000 each employee for bodily injury by accident and $500,000 each employee for bodily injury by disease.
perturbation.changed_text: (b) Racing shall obtain and maintain the following types of insurance coverage: (i) Commercial General Liability. (ii) Racing Owners' Sponsors (Spectators) Legal Liability including Participant Legal Liability. (iii) Business Automobile Liability including statutory coverages for all states of operations. (iv) Workers Compensation—statutory limits for all states of operation. (v) Employers Liability.
perturbation.explanation: This change removes the specific minimum coverage limits for the various insurance policies that Racing is required to maintain, except for the statutory workers' compensation. This introduces a legal risk because it weakens the Sponsor's protection. Without the minimum limits the sponsor has no security as to how protected they are in cases of liability and litigation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Texas Insurance Code, standard business practices for liability insurance

perturbation.original_text: (c) Racing shall provide the Sponsor with a certificate of insurance evidence compliance with the insurance requirements set forth above. Certificates shall provide that "Gainsco Inc. and all related entities" shall be named as additional insureds on all liability policies, stating that such insurance is primary in coverage to any other insurance which may be available to the Sponsor, and providing at least thirty (30) days' prior written notice to the Sponsor of termination, cancellation, modification or material change to the policy.
perturbation.changed_text: (c) Racing shall provide the Sponsor with a certificate of insurance. Certificates shall provide that "Gainsco Inc. and all related entities" shall be named as additional insureds on all liability policies.
perturbation.explanation: This change removes the requirement for the certificate to 'evidence compliance with the insurance requirements set forth above', removes 'stating that such insurance is primary in coverage to any other insurance which may be available to the Sponsor' and eliminates the requirement of providing at least thirty (30) days' prior written notice to the Sponsor of termination, cancellation, modification or material change to the policy. By deleting the compliance clause the Sponsor has no guarantee that Racing will actually follow the insurance terms, and by not requiring the insurance to be primary the Sponsor may have to cover costs the Racing Team would typically be responsible for. This weakens the Sponsors position and protections.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Texas Insurance Code, standard business practices for liability insurance
